intro: Plectocomia billitonensis, commonly known as the Billiton mountain pine, is a rare and endangered conifer native to the high elevations of the Andes in Colombia. It is characterized by its slender, needle-like leaves and a slow growth rate, which contributes to its limited distribution. The plant thrives in cool, moist environments with well-drained soil, typically found in cloud forests. Its cones are small and woody, containing seeds that are dispersed by wind. Due to habitat loss and climate change, Plectocomia billitonensis faces significant conservation challenges.
